text: The 2011 international cricket season was from April 2011 to September 2011. The season saw England take the ICC Test Championship number-one ranking from India when England defeated India in a home Test series 4–0. Australia continued to top the ICC ODI Championship rankings, a position they had held since September 2009. India, despite winning the ICC World Cup the previous season, dropped from number two to number five in September 2011 after losing 0–3 in a five-match ODI series in England. ==Season overview== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; white-space:nowrap" ! colspan=6 | International tours |- ! rowspan=2 | Start date ! rowspan=2 | Home team ! rowspan=2 | Away team ! colspan=6 class="unsortable" | Results [Matches] |- ! width=50 | Test ! width=50 | ODI ! width=50 | T20I |- | style="text-align:left" | | style="text-align:left" | | style="text- align:left" | | — || 0–3 [3] || — |- | style="text-align:left" | | style="text-align:left" | | style="text-align:left" | | 1–1 [2] || 2–3 [5] || 1–0 [1] |- | style="text-align:left" | | style="text-align:left" | | style="text-align:left" | | 1–0 [3] || 3–2 [5] || 0–1 [1] |- | style="text- align:left" | | style="text-align:left" | | style="text-align:left" | | — || 0–2 [2] || — |- | style="text-align:left" | | style="text-align:left" | | style="text-align:left" | | 0–1 [3] || 2–3 [5] || 0–1 [1] |- | style="text- align:left" | | style="text-align:left" | | style="text-align:left" | | 4–0 [4] || 3–0 [5] || 1–0 [1] |- | style="text-align:left" | | style="text- align:left" | | style="text-align:left" | | 1–0 [1] || 3–2 [5] || — |- | style="text-align:left" | | style="text-align:left" | | style="text- align:left" | | 0–1 [3] || 2–3 [5] || 2–0 [2] |- | style="text-align:left" | | style="text-align:left" | | style="text-align:left" | | —|| 0–1 [1] || — |- | style="text-align:left" | | style="text-align:left" | | style="text- align:left" | | 0–1 [1] || 0–3 [3] || 0–2 [2] |- | style="text-align:left" | | style="text-align:left" | | style="text-align:left" | | — || — || 1–1 [2] |- class="sortbottom" ! colspan=6 | Other international series |- class="sortbottom" !
